result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Hoverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid $25.00 a month commencing 11/15/22 and on the 15th each month thereafter until paid in full or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Hoverson

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Anna Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Case called at 9:19 a.m.
Attorney Cristian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Mark A Hoverson. 
Defendant Mark A Hoverson in court. 
State moves to amend count 1 to a county ordinance of Possession of Marijuana, Statute13-102(c)(13).
Defendant has no objections.  Court grants the amendment.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 11-15-2022 and the 15th of every month until paid in full.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:13 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Mark A Hoverson in court. 

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
The Defendant was taken into custody for a Jefferson County Warrant.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
